alert.note: Alert for Barry; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 1:22AM CDT until March 24 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... Southern Stone County in southwestern Missouri... Taney County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 515 AM CDT. * At 122 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kimberling City, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Indian Point, Branson West, Shell Knob, Golden, Table Rock, Emerald Beach, Kirbyville, Eagle Rock, Lampe, Cape Fair, Ridgedale, Ozark Beach, Table Rock Lake, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock State Park, Shepherd of the Hills State Park and Roaring River State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Trigger Creek at Highway J. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
